quote: The fundamental claim of intelligent design is straightforward and easily intelligible: namely, there are natural systems that cannot be adequately explained in terms of undirected natural forces and that exhibit features which in any other circumstance we would attribute to intelligence.
author: William A. Dembski,  The Design Revolution: Answering the Toughest Questions about Intelligent Design

quote: The intelligent have plans; the wise have principles.
author: Raheel Farooq

quote: An intelligent person looks for problems to solve. The wise person looks for solutions.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: You are intelligent if you know what you do not know.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Human beings are nothing but intellectually organized closely interconnected interestingly and independently functioning trillions of atoms. We manipulate these atoms by our thoughts. At the same time, thoughts are the byproducts of complex interactions of these intelligent atoms.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Sculpture is the art of the intelligence.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Art is pattern informed by sensibility.
author: Herbert Read

quote: A lot of art and visual crafts are based on appropriating things.
author: Lazaro Hernandez

quote: Rules and models destroy genius and art.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Elegance in Simplicity [10w] The more complex the problem,the simpler the correct answer.
author: Beryl Dov

quote: Creativity is intelligence having fun.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Design is the method of putting form and content together. Design, just as art, has multiple definitions; there is no single definition. Design can be art. Design can be aesthetics. Design is so simple, that's why it is so complicated.
author: Paul Rand

quote: think of it.' said Robert Rosenbluth, a doctor whose acquaintance i made at the start of this book. 'no engineer could design something as multifunctional and fine tuned as an anus. to call someone an asshole is really bragging him up.
author: Mary Roach,  Gulp: Adventures on the Alimentary Canal

quote: A common mistake that people make when trying to design something completely foolproof is to underestimate the ingenuity of complete fools.
author: Douglas Adams,  Mostly Harmless

quote: Game design is a funny thing. There are people out there who are really good at it, but it's not clear that they can teach it. It's a very intuitive process. It's an art.
author: Luis von Ahn

quote: With every choice you create the life you’ll live; with every decision you design it.
author: Mollie Marti,  Walking with Justice: Uncommon Lessons from One of Life's Greatest Mentors

quote: We have become, by the power of a glorious evolutionary accident called intelligence, the stewards of life's continuity on earth. We did not ask for this role, but we cannot abjure it. We may not be suited to it, but here we are.
author: Stephen Jay Gould,  The Flamingo's Smile: Reflections in Natural History

quote: If Darwinists are opposed to mentioning scientific problems with their view, you would think they would be even more opposed to mentioning intelligent design. Yet Darwinists have been discussing ID in public school science classes for years... Biology textbooks have been mentioning intelligent design since the late 1990s—but only to misrepresent and disparage it.
author: Jonathan Wells,  The Politically Incorrect Guide to Darwinism And Intelligent Design

quote: The knowledge of all things is possible
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: Down there between our legs, it's like an entertainment complex in the middle of a sewage system. Who designed that?
author: Neil deGrasse Tyson,  Space Chronicles: Facing the Ultimate Frontier

quote: To design the future effectively, you must first let go of your past.
author: Charles J. Givens

quote: Intelligence minus purpose equals stupidity.
author: Toba Beta,  Master of Stupidity

quote: There is no reason to assume that the universe has the slightest interest in intelligence—or even in life. Both may be random accidental by-products of its operations like the beautiful patterns on a butterfly's wings. The insect would fly just as well without them.
author: Arthur C. Clarke

quote: Along every step on our journey through life, our mind is being programmed. If we are not programming it ourselves, someone else is doing it to us.
author: Joseph Rain

quote: Sometimes I can't figure designers out. It's as if they flunked human anatomy.
author: Erma Bombeck

quote: Ideas come from everything
author: Alfred Hitchcock

quote: the mind is a neural computer
author: Steven Pinker,  How the Mind Works

quote: I did not direct my life. I didn't design it. I never made decisions. Things always came up and made them for me. That's what life is.
author: B. F. Skinner

quote: There's design, and there's art. Good design is total harmony. There's no better designer than nature - if you look at a branch or a leaf, it's perfect. It's all function. Art is different. It's about emotion. It's about suffering and beauty - but mostly suffering!
author: Diane von Furstenberg

quote: Teaching students the evidence for and against Darwinism is not the same as teaching intelligent design. The U.S. Congress has officially endorsed teaching students 'the full range of scientific views' about Darwinian evolution.
author: Jonathan Wells,  The Politically Incorrect Guide to Darwinism And Intelligent Design

quote: As architect of your reality, you are empowered to create it as you choose.
author: Amy Leigh Mercree,  The Spiritual Girl's Guide to Dating: Your Enlightened Path to Love, Sex, & Soul Mates

quote: Architecture is basically the design of interiors, the art of organizing interior space.
author: Philip Johnson

quote: Human beings have an extraordinary capacity to imagine possibilities and then turn those possibilities into realities. Evident in the gifts of civilization—in our arts, languages, sciences, technologies, businesses, governments, and so on—it is clear that we are a profoundly creative species. Yet many of us only access a smidgen of our creativity.
author: Scott Edmund Miller

quote: Logic: The art of thinking and reasoning in strict accordance with the limitations and incapacities of the human misunderstanding.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: Logic is one thing, the human animal another. You can quite easily propose a logical solution to something and at the same time hope in your heart of hearts it won't work out.
author: Luigi Pirandello

quote: Art has to move you and design does not, unless it's a good design for a bus.
author: David Hockney

quote: Fine art is knowledge made visible.
author: Gustave Courbet

quote: Remember, always, that everything you know, and everything everyone knows, is only a model. Get your model out there where it can be viewed. Invite others to challenge your assumptions and add their own.
author: Donella H. Meadows,  Thinking in Systems: A Primer

quote: Intelligent men are dangerous.
author: Patricia Briggs,  Dragon Bones

quote: I think, aesthetically, car design is so interesting - the dashboards, the steering wheels, and the beauty of the mechanics. I don't know how any of it works, I don't want to know, but it's inspirational.
author: Paloma Picasso

quote: In some remote corner of the universe, poured out and glittering among innumerable solar systems, there once was a star on which clever animals invented knowledge.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: It's clever, but is it Art?
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: A concept is a brick. It can be used to build a courthouse of reason. Or it can be thrown through the window.
author: Gilles Deleuze,  A Thousand Plateaus: Capitalism and Schizophrenia

quote: Our care of the child should be governed, not by the desire to make him learn things, but by the endeavor always to keep burning within him that light which is called intelligence.
author: Maria Montessori

quote: We demand rigidly defined areas of doubt and uncertainty!
author: Douglas Adams,  The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy

quote: Everything must be made as simple as possible. But not simpler.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Intelligence is the capacity to perceive the essential, the what is; and to awaken this capacity, in oneself and in others, is education.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti,  Education and the Significance of Life

quote: Reinvent new combinations of what you already own. Improvise. Become more creative. Not because you have to, but because you want to. Evolution is the secret for the next step.
author: Karl Lagerfeld

quote: We at BMW do not build cars as consumer objects, just to drive from A to B. We build mobile works of art.
author: Chris Bangle

quote: An intelligent man is one who acknowledges his intelligence as that of those who surround him.
author: Ilyas Kassam
